paragraphs.content: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!

paragraphs.content: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.

paragraphs.content: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.

paragraphs.content: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.

paragraphs.content: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.

paragraphs.content: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.

paragraphs.content: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.

paragraphs.content: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.

paragraphs.content: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Art thou not from everlasting, O LORD my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Art thou not from everlasting, O Lord my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O Lord, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.

paragraphs.content: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?

paragraphs.content: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?

paragraphs.content: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.

paragraphs.content: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.

paragraphs.content: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
